definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

pinyin: he2 dong4 li4 hang2 kong1 mu3 jian4

sentences.english: How long has nuclear power been known to scientists?
sentences.chinese: 核动力为科学家所认识己经有多久了？

sentences.english: In 1973 the heavy nuclear missile cruiser “Orlan” was designed.
sentences.chinese: 1973年，大型核动力巡洋舰“奥尔兰”设计完成。

sentences.english: France can claim successes in nuclear power and high-speed rail.
sentences.chinese: 法国的产业政策成功地推动了核动力和高铁的发展。

sentences.english: The submarine is driven by nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 这艘潜艇是由核动力驱动的。

sentences.english: The Shipyard has pioneered an environmentally safe method of deactivating and recycling nuclear-powered ships.
sentences.chinese: 造船厂，摸索了环境安全的方法再造失核动力船舶。

sentences.english: S. troops and a nuclear-powered aircraft carrie have already been dispatched to assist.
sentences.chinese: 美国部队和核动力航母亦已被派遣前往协助。

sentences.english: Accessing the gas riches of Uranus will require nuclear power, however.
sentences.chinese: 访问天然气丰富的天王星需要核动力，无论如何。

sentences.english: Commissioned in 1961, it's the world's first nuclear-powered aircraft carrier.
sentences.chinese: 在1961年启用，它是世界上第一个核动力航母。

sentences.english: Let us increase the use of renewable power and emissions-free nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 让我们增加可再生动力和无排放核动力的使用。

sentences.english: India is expected to launch a locally built nuclear- powered submarine this month.
sentences.chinese: 印度一艘国产核动力潜艇预计将于本月下水。

sentences.english: Currently the United States Nuclear Navy has over a hundred nuclear-powered boats.
sentences.chinese: 现在，美国核海军已经拥有超过一百艘核动力船只了。

definition: aircraft carrier/abbr. for 航空母艦|航空母舰[hang2 kong1 mu3 jian4]

pinyin: he2 dong4 li4 hang2 kong1 mu3 jian4

definition: aircraft carrier/CL:艘[sou1]/(coll.) (fig.) sth huge/(like) a whale

pinyin: gong1 ji1 xing2 he2 qian2 ting3

definition: Liaoning, the first aircraft carrier commissioned into the PLA Navy (commissioned in 2012)
